newsitem.title: JAPAN: Sony says in talks on investing in JSkyB.
newsitem.headline: Sony says in talks on investing in JSkyB.

text.p: Sony Corp confirmed on Friday that it is in talks on investing in News Corp's Japanese satellite broadcasting venture, but added that no final decision had been made.
"It is true that we consider JSkyB a possible investment target and are continuing negotiations on this. But we have not reached a final decision," Sony said in a statement.
The statement also said Sony plans to move into broadcasting in a way that would allow it to fully take advantage of its wide variety of movies, television programmes and music software.

On Thursday, Sony announced that it would set up a company in March with its units Sony Pictures Entertainment (Japan) Inc and Sony Music Entertainment (Japan) Inc, pulling together its content, television-top boxes and other business related to digital broadcasting.
Earlier, Softbank Corp, which is already a partner in JSkyB along with News Corp, said it and Sony were positively considering the possibility of Sony participating in JSkyB.
The financial daily Nihon Keizai Shimbun reported on Friday that Sony hoped to take a one-third stake in JSkyB.
